alert.note: Alert for Neshoba (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 13 at 2:24PM CDT until further notice by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Mississippi... Pearl River Above Philadelphia affecting Neshoba County. For the Upper Pearl River...including Philadelphia, Edinburg, Carthage, Walnut Grove, Lena, Kosciusko, Ratliff`s Ferry, Ofahoma, Jackson...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pearl River Above Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, The open air pavilion at Burnside Lake Water Park is inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.0 feet early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 04/08/2014. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Pearl River Philadelphi 13.0 13.1 Thu 1 pm CDT 15.7 16.6 15.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 24 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued late tonight at 9 PM CDT.
